Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I am looking for the details of the now cancelled Orion Mars mission. The exact number of launches, their launch order and what was launched.

I have searched the t'internet to no avail.

Has anyone come across anything like this?

Thanks in advance.

MJ

i found this:

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/uUBhn3_P3hU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Edited July 17, 2014 by whaaw
There is also an amazing KSP recreation of it, which you can view here:

I think one of these wouldn't be to hard to do in ksp. Why do you want the details? Planning on making a mod? Or maybe a stock version?

Edit-whoa, someones already done this in ksp? (that post didn't load before I put the earlier comment in it)

I don't think there was ever a Constellation-specific, officially approved Mars plan. When people speak of "Constellation Mars mission" what they usually mean is the NASA Design Reference Mission. So this is probably what you are looking for: http://www.nasa.gov/pdf/373665main_NASA-SP-2009-566.pdf

Edit: Given that doing this is in regular KSP is already impressive, what do we call it when someone does that in RSS? This guy did just that:

For reference: It takes a minimum of 20 500 m/s of delta-v to do this mission in RSS. 20 friggin thousand, seriously, and that's with maximum use of aerobraking.

Edited July 17, 2014 by Hattivat

Thanks everyone!!

Yes I have drooled over that video!!

Yeah its for a stock recreation. This is going to take a few weeks!!

Edit: Given that doing this is in regular KSP is already impressive, what do we call it when someone does that in RSS? This guy did just that:

WOW! That's very impressive. Its not a constellation recreation though. You know, seven launches, landers first then crew, many rovers and gizmos.

I found this:

It shows it all! Thank you for those who commented.
